Description: Body sherd of North Ionian pottery plate; cream slip; exterior: four bands preserved above long rays at base; interior, from outside: metope band of solid and quartered squares (with added red paint) alternating with vertical lines, between pairs of dilute lines; frieze with hindquarters of a sphinx to left and lion to right attacking a boar; band with added red band lined in white; frieze with tail of a lion to right (?) and blob-rosette. Added red on parts of the animals and of sphinx; incision used for the outline and details of animals and of sphinx.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Dr David George Hogarth
Curator's comments: Object owned and held by the Ashmolean Museum, Oxford. This record is included in the British Museum database as part of the Museum’s Naukratis Project, a research collaboration that aims to virtually re-unite finds from the ancient port city of Naukratis, now distributed over 80 museums worldwide.
Very close to British Museum 1965,0930.497, but with different underside decoration, rays not bands.
Bibliographic references: Villing et al 2013-2015 / Naukratis: Greeks in Egypt (GG.737)
Previous owner: Currently owned by: Ashmolean Museum, University of Oxford
